intro: Anaphalis alpicola, commonly known as the alpine candleplant, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its fluffy, white capitula that resemble candles. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are narrow and silvery-haired, adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Anaphalis alpicola is often found at high altitudes, contributing to the unique flora of mountain ecosystems.
